author: terencechain
content: The current PTC selection algorithm doesn't consider validator effective balance, so a validator with an effective balance of 2048 ETH has the same chance of being selected as PTC as a validator with 32 ETH. Intuitively, this seems off, but I don't see any real issue with it. In fact, it might be preferable since being PTC carries more riskâ€”if the proposer fails to propose, there's a lost reward. Treating a 2048 ETH validator like a 32 ETH validator might inherently reduce that risk...
